benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/block - Block a bundle

covered: POST Valid Payload: TC01 covers successful creation with required payload.
Invalid Payload: TC08 tests malformed/missing fields in blocking state body.
Missing Request Body: TC10 covers missing body scenario.
Missing / Invalid Headers: TC09 and TC18 cover missing authentication header and invalid token cases.
Successful creation with all headers/params: TC02 and TC03/TC04 cover optional headers and query params.
Bundle existence/ID validation: TC05 (no bundles) and TC06 (invalid bundleId format) and TC07 (non-existent bundleId) cover ID-related validation.
Error handling for missing bundle: TC05/TC07 cover 404 scenarios.
Malformed request body handling: TC08 covers 400 for invalid body.
Optional headers/params handling: TC03/TC04 show behavior with optional headers and query params.
Authentication/Authorization: TC09/TC18 cover missing/invalid authentication scenarios.
Resource not found: TC05/TC07 cover 404 when bundle not found.
Validation - date format: TC11 tests invalid requestedDate format.
Large payload tests: TC16 covers large payload scenarios (or failure if limits exceeded).
Stress/concurrency: TC22 (concurrent requests), TC21 (network retry), TC27 (bulk concurrency) cover concurrency aspects.
Error propagation from dependencies: TC28 (integration error leading to 502/503).
Integration/data consistency: TC29 ensures consistency across systems.
Regression - special characters and compatibility: TC23/TC24 cover regression and backward compatibility.
Performance - response time: TC25/TC26 cover normal/peak load performance.
Accessibility: TC30 covers API documentation accessibility.
gaps: Duplicate submission handling: No explicit test ensuring idempotency or handling of repeated identical submissions.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests validating behavior under rapid consecutive requests.
Caching behavior: No tests verifying caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or related caching semantics for this POST.
Pagination: Not applicable for POST create endpoints, but guidelines mention for GET-related listing scenarios (not needed here).
Explicit 500 Internal Server Error simulation: Tests cover 502/503 integration errors but not a pure 500 scenario for server/db failures.
Edge-case header validation: While some header cases are covered, broader exhaustive header validation (e.g., all combinations, invalid header values) is not present.
recommendations: Add a dedicated test for idempotent/duplicate submissions to ensure duplicates are handled gracefully or ignored.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to confirm proper handling under burst traffic.
Add tests for caching headers and validation of caching behavior for POST responses if applicable (ETag/Cache-Control).
Include a pure 500 Internal Server Error scenario to validate server-side failure handling apart from upstream dependency errors.
Expand header validation coverage with additional invalid/malformed header combinations to ensure robust error handling.
